title.narrative: PUBLIC AWARENESS ON CHILD RIGHTS

description.narrative: 5.1. The general public has access to information, initiatives, and platforms to increase public awareness and engagement on child rights., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, a mobilized society drives public action that accelerates the realization of the rights of children and adolescents, especially for those most disadvantaged.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: UNICEF evidence-based advocacy strategies contributed to position key children and adolescents&39; issues in the public agenda during 2016-2021 and specially during the first and second wave of the pandemic.
